FuncDef: By default, a router compares the MED attributes of the routes to be used for load balancing.
ExtraInfo:
After the load-balancing med-ignore command is run, a device does not compare the MED attributes of the routes to be used for load balancing. Exercise caution when using the command because the execution of this command will change the conditions of load balancing.
When routes are used for load balancing, the device processes the MED attribute as follows:
